title: The unexpected results of having Draft Pick
body:
It feels amazing having draft pick, we have been waiting for so long for it, and been imagining playing it for so long, but now it is actually here, I'm finding things that I didn't think of. For example:

1. Im not the kind of guy that takes pleasure in my own team's misfortunes, but Im finding a sly smirk on my face whenever I see someone on my team declare their pick as Yasuo. The naiveté is just so juicy! Seeing it banned right out from under them **every time**, and knowing it is coming is just somehow so satisfying xD

2. I don't dislike blind pick at all, for a while a long time ago I was actually pro-blind over draft, and I thought having draft would just be a nice treat every now and then when its up, but having draft pick up now and tasting it, makes blind pick feel so so much worse... 
Draft is up, I immediately ban Lee Sin, my team bans Zed, the enemy bans Yasuo, Darius also gets caught up in the crossfire. The enemy team picks a real mid laner, so I show them the same courtesy and pick a champ that I wouldn't usually play, we have a mid lane like the good old days used to be, mage vs mage, poke vs poke, with actual mana, none of that energy or flow crap! it's great!
Next game, I go to pick draft... but obviously in Aussie it's a different time, because draft is no longer there! So I click blind. Get camped all game by lvl 7 Lee who spams his mastery every time he does anything. Now that is nothing out of the ordinary, but after knowing that you _could_ be playing a game without that shit, just makes it feel so much worse.

3. I actually find myself playing League less now O_o
It's spoilt me! Every time I want to play, I log on, hover over blind pick and just pause, I want to press the button, I want to play, but I know Lee Sin is waiting there, behind that button.  And the little voice in my head says: "Why? Why put yourself through that, when later on in the day, you wont have to." and I think: "Maybe... maybe I just don't play?.. maybe.. maybe I play Elder Scrolls Online instead, just until Draft is up?". I would rather play league than work on mindless crafting and motif farming all day on ESO, but the alternative is Lee Sin...
Before when there wasn't an option, there was no choice, if you wanted to play league, you just had to deal with whatever came your way! But now, you know that in a few hours you'll be able to play in peace against like-minded people, so if you do play now, and you get Yasuo and Lee Sin and all the rest, it feels worse because it's self inflicted! because you know could have simply avoided the heartache by just playing later on in the day.

It's strange xD
But I am so thankful and grateful that Draft is here now!
The small taste just makes me want it so much more!!

replies.body:
I've been saying for a long time that if OCE is going to only have one queue, it should be Draft Pick. The games are generally so much more satisfying, calling roles is no longer a problem, and you get a chance to change Rune & Mastery pages to mitigate hard match-ups.

Unfortunately, queue health will be a big issue if Riot brings back Draft Queue because the playerbase will potentially be split across Blind, Draft, SoloQ, Flex, 3v3 and the Featured Game Mode depending on the day of the week (which leads back to my first statement - if we have to have one Normal Q, it should be Draft Pick).
Agreed. If I had to pick one, I'd pick Draft any day of the week.

I streamed the first and last night of this test, and I have to say it's been the best quality matches I've played in a long time.

Very little in the way of "toxic" behavior, no complaints in champ select, and not having to deal with Zed, Vayne and Lee Sin all in the one match.

The only "toxic" players I've come across in it are your absolute gone who will be getting permabanned.

Yea thats a good way of putting it! the "quality" of the matches is definitely higher.

I think toxic players are attracted to champs that are the same _(its very rare that you find a genuinely nice, non-arrogant, non-cocky Lee Sin, just like its rare to get a Vayne that doesnt think she knows best and thinks the entire team is her personal plaything to boss around)_, so in a game mode where many of the toxic champs are excluded, the toxic people seem to take themselves elsewhere.

Honestly I don't watch him much. (usually watch him VIA lolChamploo)
But he's a great person who happens to play Lee Sin.

https://www.twitch.tv/cellybeary

Also Oceanic!

It's been obvious forever that everyone prefers draft pick, there shouldn't even be a need to "test" it. Just straight up remove blind pick and give us the more balanced option of playing League of legends. The one that everyone CLEARLY enjoys.

Unfortunately removing blind pick completely in favor of draft is not an option. 

Newer players would not be able to play due to the minimum of 20 champs needed to participate in draft normal games.

"Newer players"

Do we still believe players are new and not just smurfs?
I actually know of 4 new players. People invite new people to play every day. Doesn't mean they stick with it. But yes there are new players.
Either way, unless they want to sink IRL money into the game they aren't going to have the 20 champs they need.
Not true, you can easily work up the IP for champions, and it's not like new players have any clue what runes are, nor do they need to learn with Runes being removed at the end of the year.

Even with a free week rotation of 14, a player would still need 6 more champions to be able to play. While it is true that there are at least 6 450IP champions, newer players shouldn't be forced to spend their IP on champions they wont necessarily play just so they can play in PVP mode. 

The new BE system does help with this a little as gaining new champs will become easier, although not enough to be able to justify a full removal of blind pick.

so why not have a roster of basic/"old" champs included as part of the game. with the amount of champions there are now and the rate of which new ones come out, there's no reason why "new players" shouldnt have 20 champions available to them at the start including the free rotation. i mean, what is even the point of 450ip champions. they might as well be free. especially considering their main competitor has all champions available for free.

when it comes to ranked you would still have the same restriction in place so a player would need to own x amount of champs not including the free rotation. or you know they could also come up with another kind of restriction. a better one that actually will battle smurfing (fat chance because they make money off this) and actually help true new players who jump into ranked way to soon. something related to time and games played at what you currently consider "max level". this would be easy to incorporate into their new leveling/progression system.

point is there is always options.

I agree here.
While Draft is amazing, blind pick needs to always be a thing, both for new players and for people who just want to play a certain champ.

Yasuo for all his flaws is a fun champ, and while I personally am in favour of him never seeing the light of day again, it would really suck for people who enjoy playing him to never be able to enjoy their favourite champ.

So I agree, blind has to stay a thing, but hopefully there is a way that draft can muscle its way into being a regular queue.

Which is why Riot needs to give new players (or rather low level accounts) more access to champions so the champion requirement won't be a problem. Like say, you start with 10 000 IP? Or you get a bunch of missions that give you champion shards as a reward? Mission could be play 5 games, win 3 games, even just play one SR game to start off with.

After playing Draft i can't go back to blind, it has too many dramas in champ select with trying to get your role and people auto locking and it's more enjoyable seeing who you go against and being able to change runes/masteries before match, no need for a test run just make it permanent please, i'd gladly wait an extra min or 2 to get my role and a good balanced game
I have to thank blind pick for making me a support main in normal games 😂

The sad thing is, me and several others have started playing again simply because of draft pick, but have to actively play around a shitty time limited test  which honestly should have been done months earlier then now.

While i haven't played it yet, about 80% of my friends are saying its fantastic.

they wait a little bit longer but the quality is there and its worth the wait.
please i need play
